info.title: SolTerm API
info.description: Comprehensive API for SolTerm SSH management, file operations, tunneling, and server monitoring. This API provides endpoints for managing SSH hosts, file operations, tunnel connections, server monitoring, user management, and system alerts.

tags.name: System
tags.description: System health, version, and release information endpoints

tags.name: SSH Hosts
tags.description: SSH host management, creation, updates, and deletion

tags.name: File Manager
tags.description: File manager operations including recent, pinned, and shortcuts

tags.name: SSH File Operations
tags.description: SSH file operations like reading, writing, creating, and deleting files

tags.name: Tunnel Management
tags.description: SSH tunnel connection, disconnection, and status management

tags.name: Server Statistics
tags.description: Server status monitoring and metrics collection

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: User authentication, login, and password management

tags.name: TOTP
tags.description: Two-factor authentication using TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password)

hostId.name: hostId
hostId.description: The ID of the SSH host

get.description: Simple health check to verify the API server is running and responsive. **Server: localhost:8081**

get.summary: Get version information and check for updates
get.description: Get version information and check for updates. **Server: localhost:8081**
Get releases in RSS format. **Server: localhost:8081**

Retrieve a list of all configured SSH hosts in the system. This endpoint requires authentication and returns host information including connection details, authentication methods, and enabled features. **Server: localhost:8081**

post.description: Create a new SSH host configuration. **Server: localhost:8081**

get.description: Get SSH host by ID. **Server: localhost:8081**
Get all SSH host folders. **Server: localhost:8081**

delete.description: Remove file from recent list. **Server: localhost:8081**

parameters.description: Whether this is an SSH file
